column2: bboop1971, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had MS for 6 years and just recently changed to this med per my pain management doctor, it has worked very well for my pain and lasts longer than Percocet. I would highly recommend this drug to someone with chronic or severe pain..

column2: Strawberryga, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for a year. I take it 4x day for neuropathy, osteoarthristis and fibro. It helps me be able to function. The quality of my life before Combunox was very low. People who are in chronic pain deserve to live a better life, and Drs are too afraid to prescribe pain meds nowadays. I would reccomend this drug to anyone who lives with pain.The only major sideeffect I have is constipation.

column9: i m going though oral sergerory (pulling allteeth) and while im down the sergeon gave me this medicaton. this med has made  possile to sleep.  the only thing that i have noticed is that you need to be careful while on this makes you dizzy while standing and made me car sick but other than that it is a major "butt-kicker" medication!

column2: ladyp, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Combunox has been a life saver for me.  I have serious back problems. I have had surgery (spinal fusion) and now I have lost the disk at L4-L5.  Combunox is very effective and I am happy to have it.  I only use it when the pain is too much to handle which fortunately I have a high tolerance for pain so I rarely use the medication.  Thank  you for this opportunity to review a medication.
